```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(logr)
```

works with an R script but not with a notebook

open log

```{r}
logfile <- log_open("logging")
logfile
```

```{r}
log_print("the mtcars data")
log_print(mtcars)
```

select the high-mileage ones

```{r}
mtcars %>% filter(mpg > 20) -> hm
log_print("the high-mileage ones")
log_print(hm)
```

done

some random data

```{r}
tibble(ix = rnorm(20), y = rpois(20, 5)) %>% log_print()
```


```{r}
log_close()
```

display the log

```{r}
system2("cat", args = logfile)
```
